[User Interface]

Displays and manipulates four-dimensional Functions in a QGLWidget. More...

Detailed Description

Displays and manipulates four-dimensional Functions in a QGLWidget.

This class is much too fat and will be split into parts wherever possible

Author:
Helge Preuss <scout@hyperspace-travel.de>

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

C4DView::C4DView ( QWidget *  parent = 0  ) 

C4DView constructor.

does a lot of initialization to (usually sensible) hardcoded default values, initializes the coordinate cross object (which could well be a class on its own), creates the necessary timers and menus, and finally creates a Hypercube as the default object to display

Parameters:
parent parent QWidget, defaults to NULL

References Menu4D::addToMenuBar(), AnimateRandomTimer, AnimationTimer, ApplyChanges(), F, InitCross(), Loki::SingletonHolder< T, CreationPolicy >::Instance(), Light(), menu, ObjectHypercube(), OnTimer(), and Values.

void C4DView::OnTimer (  )  [protected, slot]

Timer event handler.

Updates values if in the middle of an animation, and renders an image.
Writes image to file too, if wanted.

void C4DView::Transform ( double  thetaxy,
double  thetaxz,
double  thetaxw,
double  thetayz,
double  thetayw,
double  thetazw,
double  tx,
double  ty,
double  tz,
double  tw 
) [protected]

Application of translations and rotations.

Calls F->Transform () and transforms the coordinate cross

Parameters:
thetaxy rotation around xy plane (z axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxz rotation around xz plane (y axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxw rotation around xw plane
thetayz rotation around xy plane (x axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetayw rotation around yw plane
thetazw rotation around zw plane
tx translation in x direction
ty translation in y direction
tz translation in z direction
tw translation in w direction

References Cross, CrossTrans, F, Rxw, Rxy, Rxz, Ryw, Ryz, and Rzw.

QPixmap C4DView::makePixmap (  )  [protected]

Make a pixmap to to be rendered by the GL widget, and render it.

this is an embarrassing workaround to make rendering to files work. QGLWidget's renderPixmap() method only produces black frames. Works with QPixmap::grabWindow() instead.

References Loki::SingletonHolder< T, CreationPolicy >::Instance().

Referenced by writeFrame().

void C4DView::UpdateStatus ( QString  status = ""  )  [protected]

display some info about current object and its transformations

In the status bar.

Side effect: checks rotation values for overflow and resets them to the interval [-360, 360].

Parameters:
status string to be displayed

References checkAnglesForOverflow(), F, and Loki::SingletonHolder< T, CreationPolicy >::Instance().
